value: content=Until the early 20th Century, Rosyth Castle was almost completely surrounded by the sea. Now, it is a slightly incongruous sight, surrounded as it is by the naval dockyards and industrial buildings, which were built on land reclaimed from the sea. The castle consists of a tower house and courtyard, largely dating from the late 15th century. It's not normally possible to access the interior of the tower house.

Most travellers arriving in Rosyth will immediately continue their journeys within Scotland. The ancient capital city,
is only 3 miles to the north, while the current capital,
is just 12 miles to the south. Fife Council runs a free shuttle bus from the ferry terminal serving the
, both of which offer ample onward connections.
